scores.description: The audit identified no critical vulnerabilities but noted some moderate issues that were adequately addressed, reflecting a strong security posture against typical smart contract vulnerabilities.
The areas related to privileged roles were well-defined with clear boundaries, though some improvements were suggested to further minimize risks.
The contract relies on several external protocols which were audited, but cross-contract interactions were noted as a potential risk area.
Extensive testing was reported with high coverage, encompassing both unit and integration tests, indicating thorough vetting of the code.
There was no evidence of formal verification in the audit, which is becoming more standard in DeFi for ensuring rigorous security guarantees.
Security measures against economic attacks were satisfactory, though recommendations were given to strengthen protections further.
A bug bounty program is in place but could be better promoted to attract higher participation from security researchers.
The audit noted several optimizations that were implemented, reducing transaction costs and increasing efficiency.
Some contracts were upgradeable, providing flexibility, though it presents challenges in ensuring static security.
Paladin Security has established a strong reputation in the industry, offering credible and reliable audit services.
The audit is recent and reflects compliance with the latest standards and code implementations as of early 2023.
Documentation was adequate but could benefit from enhanced clarity and detail for easier comprehension by third parties.
Non-technical risks were acknowledged, including team reputation and regulatory risks, though without in-depth analysis.
